title: PIER ORB / ultraliberal quest pre-cindy
description: Savoir Faire spots Cindy and gives you a pep talk before you try to negotiate for her art.

dialogueTree.title: Savoir Faire: "There! Right in front of you. Do yo..."
dialogueTree.text: There! Right in front of you. Do you see it?

links.title: You: "See *what*? (Squint your eyes.)"
links.text: See *what*? (Squint your eyes.)

links.title: Savoir Faire: "The *artisto*. Now hold up, you can..."
links.text: The *artisto*. Now hold up, you can't go into a bullring without a prep talk. It's baby's first sales negotiation after all! Savvy's gotta give you the do-s and don't-s.

links.title: Pain Threshold: "That's a pathetic-looking *bull*. W..."
links.text: That's a pathetic-looking *bull*. Where are the sharpened horns ready to puncture your gristle? There's no real danger here.

links.title: Drama: "Rehearsal helps fine tune a perform..."
links.text: Rehearsal helps fine tune a performance. Learn your lines so they can flow out of you like Herc Zeitung's legendary soliloquy in 'Hoppla, jetzt komm ich!'!

links.title: You: "Alright, I'm listening."
links.text: Alright, I'm listening.

links.title: Savoir Faire: "Artistos are known to *repel* wealt..."
links.text: Artistos are known to *repel* wealth. It bounces off their skin like rubber. The moment a reasonable business proposal enters their periphery, they go and get 'political'.

links.title: Suggestion: "Nonsense, no one 'repels wealth', t..."
links.text: Nonsense, no one 'repels wealth', the businessmen just don't know how to entice them.

links.title: Rhetoric: "It's true, some of them are known t..."
links.text: It's true, some of them are known to turn the entire thing into a happening.

links.title: Half Light: "Oh no, not a *happening*!! I don't..."
links.text: Oh no, not a *happening*!! I don't like the sound of that...

links.title: Savoir Faire: "What you need to do is lure them in..."
links.text: What you need to do is lure them in with a strong one-liner -- get them on your side before you've even finished a sentence. Show us what you've got -- pretend you're facing the SKULL-girl!

links.title: Savoir Faire: "What you need to do is lure them in..."
links.text: What you need to do is lure them in with a strong one-liner -- get them on your side before you've even finished a sentence. Show us what you've got -- pretend you're facing the girl!

links.title: You: "(Lean in.) Hey beautiful. Let's go..."
links.text: (Lean in.) Hey beautiful. Let's go for a walk on the *wild side*.

links.title: Savoir Faire: "What is this, a dating agency? Are..."
links.text: What is this, a dating agency? Are you looking for a Pretty Young Thing to sponsor? Never mix business and pleasure -- *never*.

links.title: Electrochemistry: "Counterpoint! What if pleasure *is*..."
links.text: Counterpoint! What if pleasure *is* your business? Gigolos make bank *and* get that wet-wet. It's never too late to change careers...

links.title: You: "Hand over your art. Put it in the b..."
links.text: Hand over your art. Put it in the bag. NOW!!

links.title: Savoir Faire: "Holy-moly, are we being arrested he..."
links.text: Holy-moly, are we being arrested here?! Only tax inspectors and debt collectors speak like that. You don't want to start your business relationship with the wrong vibe.

links.title: Reaction Speed: "But it would catch her off-guard. T..."
links.text: But it would catch her off-guard. That's *always* an advantage.

links.title: You: "Excuse me, could I please take a lo..."
links.text: Excuse me, could I please take a look at your art?

links.title: Savoir Faire: "Boring... BORING... Yawning my jaw..."
links.text: Boring... BORING... Yawning my jaw off here... Next!

links.title: Empathy: "It's polite. What's wrong with bein..."
links.text: It's polite. What's wrong with being polite?

links.title: You: "It's your lucky day! I'm in the mar..."
links.text: It's your lucky day! I'm in the market for some original *art* by the crème de la crème.

links.title: Savoir Faire: "Mamma mia, if this isn't the Top Se..."
links.text: Mamma mia, if this isn't the Top Seller in La Delta! Everyone knew you'd eventually get it right...

links.title: Suggestion: "Hmm, it's a decent start, but you m..."
links.text: Hmm, it's a decent start, but you might need to change strategies down the line...

links.title: Savoir Faire: "Okay then, off you go! Let's see wh..."
links.text: Okay then, off you go! Let's see what you've got.

links.title: Savoir Faire: "Mamma mia, if this isn't the Top Se..."
links.text: Mamma mia, if this isn't the Top Seller in La Delta! No one expected you to nail this on the *first* try -- *congratulazioni*!

links.title: You: "(Whip out your finger pistols and b..."
links.text: (Whip out your finger pistols and bang them in the sky.) It's your lucky day! I'm in the market for some original *art* by the crème de la crème.

links.title: You: "I've got this. Trust me. [Leave.]"
links.text: I've got this. Trust me. [Leave.]

links.title: You: "Cindy? Yes, that's where I'm headed..."
links.text: Cindy? Yes, that's where I'm headed...

links.title: Savoir Faire: "Straight into a bullring with no pr..."
links.text: Straight into a bullring with no prep talk? No-no-no. It's your first sales negotiation, Savvy's gotta give you the do-s and don't-s.

links.title: You: "Not now. I'm on a roll. [Leave.]"
links.text: Not now. I'm on a roll. [Leave.]

links.title: Savoir Faire: "A streak of individuality? As you w..."
links.text: A streak of individuality? As you wish...

dialogueTree.title: Savoir Faire: "There! On that balcony. Do you see..."
dialogueTree.text: There! On that balcony. Do you see it?

dialogueTree.title: Savoir Faire: "There! Right in front of you. Do yo..."
dialogueTree.text: There! Right in front of you. Do you see it? It's an artist!

links.title: Conceptualization: "A strong aura of *originality* surr..."
links.text: A strong aura of *originality* surrounds the girl in question.

links.title: Half Light: "Quick, kill it with fire before it..."
links.text: Quick, kill it with fire before it organises a *happening*!

links.title: You: "How can you tell?"
links.text: How can you tell?

links.title: Savoir Faire: "The dishevelled hair, cheap clothes..."
links.text: The dishevelled hair, cheap clothes, slumping posture that suggests an unearned sense of superiority...

links.title: Empathy: "Hints of deep emotional trauma that..."
links.text: Hints of deep emotional trauma that have led to ironic detachment...

links.title: Savoir Faire: "It's all there if you know how to r..."
links.text: It's all there if you know how to read people. Commanders of the streets like me have it down to a tee. I'll teach you. Listen up...

links.title: You: "Yes, I can sense the *originality*...."
links.text: Yes, I can sense the *originality*...

links.title: Savoir Faire: "Seems to be one of those conceptual..."
links.text: Seems to be one of those conceptual types... not good. If we proceed cautiously we might get something tangible out of her.

links.title: You: "Alright, I'm listening. What's the..."
links.text: Alright, I'm listening. What's the plan?

links.title: You: "I know how to handle this, no need..."
links.text: I know how to handle this, no need to coach me. [Leave.]

links.title: Savoir Faire: "A streak of individuality. As you w..."
links.text: A streak of individuality. As you wish...

links.title: You: "All stations beware, it's a level t..."
links.text: All stations beware, it's a level three happening-alert!

links.title: Savoir Faire: "Yes, this seems to be one of those..."
links.text: Yes, this seems to be one of those *conceptual* types... not good. If we proceed cautiously we might get something tangible out of her.

links.title: You: "Not now. I'm on a roll. [Leave.]"
links.text: Not now. I'm on a roll. [Leave.]

dialogueTree.title: Savoir Faire: "There! On that balcony. Do you see..."
dialogueTree.text: There! On that balcony. Do you see it? It's an artist!
